question.questionA: Whole  plant  yellowish,  glandular  pubescent; calyx segments connate  for about half their length, bifid with broad triangular teeth.
Stems and bracts very dark purple, coated with white hairs; corolla lilac, turning pink.
Stems  and  corolla bright red; lobes of corolla fringed with bright  yellow.
Bracts prominent,  exceeding mature  flowers;  stems  reddish brown; corolla white or yellowish white with violet markings.
question.questionB: Bracts inconspicuous, not exceeding mature flowers.

question.questionA: Flowers subtended by three bracts; corolla violet or blue.
question.questionB: Flowers subtended by one bract; corolla yellow, whitish or reddish

question.questionA: Stigma lobes yellow, white or orange.
question.questionB: Stigma lobes usually purple, red or brown

question.questionA: Flowers 15-30 mm, smelling of carnations; corolla white with violet veins.
question.questionB: Flowers 10-18 mm; corolla yellowish, flushed and veined with purple.
